intro: Pratia longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stalked pratia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and are accompanied by small, fleshy fruits. Pratia longipedicellata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
